alert.note: Alert for Eastern Cherry; Western Cherry (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 21 at 4:17PM CDT by NWS NorthPlatte
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT SOUTHEASTERN CHERRY COUNTY THROUGH 500 PM CDT... At 417 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 11 miles west of Brownlee, or 16 miles northeast of Mullen, moving northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Brownlee, Valentine National Wildlife Refuge, Giant Hill, and Highway 83 crossing Goose Creek. This includes the following highways... Highway 97 between mile markers 102 and 107. Highway 83 between mile markers 175 and 187. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. To report severe weather, contact your nearest law enforcement agency. They will relay your report to the National Weather Service office in North Platte.
